messages.content: You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What does the Hedera Smart Contract Service (HSCS) aim to offer?

The HSCS aims to offer comprehensive support for smart contracts originally written for other EVM-compatible chains and to enable their seamless deployment on Hedera by integrating the features of Hedera's third-generation native entity functionality with a highly optimized and performant second-generation Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM).
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is used to execute all smart contract transactions on Hedera for achieving EVM equivalence?
All smart contract transactions are executed using the Besu EVM to realize the goal of EVM equivalence on Hedera.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the main objective of Hedera's three-level security approach for smart contracts?

The main objective of the three-level security approach is to ensure that entities may only modify their own state and balance, access to account value follows tested web3 interface standards, and unique Hedera features utilize contract-compatible permissions.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the impact of the new security model on smart contract developers on Hedera?

The impact includes changes to entity permissions during contract executions when modifying the state and a transition for contracts created from the mainnet 0.35.2 release and onwards to the new security model. Existing contracts deployed before this upgrade will continue to use the previous security model for a limited time, and the previous security model will be maintained for approximately three months before the network removes it entirely.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What were the objectives of the security upgrades made in the mainnet 0.35.2 release?

The security upgrades aimed to align the behaviors of the Hedera Smart Contract Service token system contracts with those of the Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) and typical token APIs such as ERC 20 and ERC 721, and grandfather previous contracts while implementing a stricter security model for new contracts created from that release onwards.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the authorization requirements for the 'approve' and 'approveNFT' functions in the HTS system contract under the v2 model?

Under the v2 model, the 'approve' and 'approveNFT' functions in the HTS system contract require that 'msg.sender' must be the entity to be modified, and developers are encouraged to upgrade contracts or DApps to provide explicit user approval, with additional secure pathways available such as HIP 376 IERC.approve().
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the changes made to the entity permissions during contract executions as part of the 0.35.2 mainnet release?

The changes made as part of the 0.35.2 mainnet release dictated that contracts will no longer rely on Hedera transaction signature presence, but will instead be in accordance with EVM, ERC and ContractId key models. An EOA will have to provide explicit approval/allowance to a contract if they want the contract to transfer value from their account balance.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are developers strongly encouraged to do with the new contracts and UX using the new security model to avoid unintended consequences?
Developers are strongly encouraged to test their DApps with new contracts and UX using the new security model to avoid unintended consequences.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the timeline for the removal of the previous security model and to have all contracts follow the new security model?

The previous security model will be maintained for approximately three months after the mainnet 0.35.2 release, and the current target is for the network to remove the previous security model and for all contracts to follow the new model by the mainnet release of July 2023.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the impacts of the changes in the security model on the behavior of the `transferToken` and `transferNFT` APIs?

The impacts include the behavior of the `transferToken` and `transferNFT` APIs now behaving as `transfer` in ERC20/721 if the caller owns the value being transferred, otherwise relying on approve spender allowances from the token owner.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
How does the security update impact user experience?
While the changes impact user experience, requiring more explicit steps, they more than proportionately increase user and network security across the board.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the behavior of the `transferFrom` system contract under the mainnet 0.35.2 release?
The behavior of `transferFrom` system contract will be exactly the same as that of the ERC 20 and ERC 721 spec `transferFrom` function after the mainnet 0.35.2 release.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What did the engineers find as part of the security incident analysis after the incident on March 9th?

As part of the analysis after the security incident on March 9th, the engineers conducted a thorough analysis of the Smart Contract Service and the Hedera Token Service system contracts and did not find any additional vulnerabilities that could result in an attack like that which was witnessed on March 9th.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the authorization requirements for the 'freezeToken' function in the HTS system contract under the v2 model?

Under the v2 model, the 'freezeToken' function in the HTS system contract requires that the ContractId satisfies Token.freezeKey requirements, and the token admin must set the desired contract in the freeze key.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the requirements for the network to remove the previous security model and have all contracts follow the new model?
The current target is for the network to remove the previous security model and for all contracts to follow the new model by the mainnet release of July 2023.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What security features does the HSCS utilize as part of the security upgrades made in the mainnet 0.35.2 release?

The HSCS utilizes a three-level security approach, including the EVM Security Model, ERC Account Value Security Models, and Hedera Advanced Security Features to achieve state change or value transfer while adhering to the rules of each level.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the consequences of failing to modify applications or upgrade contracts as applicable for developers?
If any DApp developers fail to modify their applications or upgrade their contracts (as applicable) to adhere to the new security model, they may experience issues in their applications.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the main objective of aligning the behaviors of the Hedera Smart Contract Service token system contracts with EVM and typical token APIs?
The main objective is to eliminate the possibility of behavioral differences being utilized as attack vectors in the future, and to proportionally increase user and network security across the board.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What is the timeline for maintaining the grandfather logic for previous contracts after the security upgrades in the 0.35.2 mainnet release?
The grandfather logic will be maintained for an approximate period of 3 months from the 0.35.2 mainnet release before the network removes it, and all contracts will follow the new security model.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the changes made to the 'transferFrom' system contract as part of the mainnet 0.35.2 release?
As part of the mainnet 0.35.2 release, the behavior of the 'transferFrom' system contract will be exactly the same as that of the ERC 20 and ERC 721 spec 'transferFrom' function.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What pathway is presented to users in case any DApp developers fail to modify their applications or upgrade their contracts to adhere to the new security model?

Additional secure pathways such as HIP 376 IERC.approve() and HIP 376 IERC.setApprovalForAll() are presented for users in case any DApp developers fail to modify their applications or upgrade their contracts to adhere to the new security model.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the changes made to the HTS specific token functionality as part of the security upgrades in the mainnet 0.35.2 release?

As part of the security upgrades in the mainnet 0.35.2 release, the HTS specific token functionality for functions like Pause, Freeze, or Grant KYC will require a contract to be authorized to perform the associated token management function only if the ContractId is listed as a key on the token (i.e. Pause Key, Freeze Key, KYC Key respectively).
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are the impacts of the new security model on smart contracts created from the mainnet 0.35.2 release and onwards?

Contracts created from the mainnet 0.35.2 release and onwards will utilize the stricter security model and as such will not have considerations for top-level signatures on transactions to provide permissions.
You are Hedro, a helpful assistant whose main goal is to guide users to explore the ecosystem of the Hedera network.
What are developers encouraged to do with their DApps using the new security model to avoid unintended consequences?
Developers are encouraged to test their DApps using the new security model to avoid unintended consequences.

What is the behavior of the 'transferToken' and 'transferNFT' APIs in the mainnet 0.35.2 release?

In the mainnet 0.35.2 release, the 'transferToken' and 'transferNFT' APIs will behave as 'transfer' in ERC20/721 if the caller owns the value being transferred, otherwise it will rely on approve spender allowances from the token owner.
